column4: Ubuntu is running slowly here - requesting links to good docs on speeding up Ubuntu. Thanks
look at top what is eating the cpu/ram
'top' apps are xorg, firefox, metacity, pidgen, gnome-terminal. Total CPU used fluctuates between 5% and 30%.
1GB, I think. What command will verify that?
please paste the output of free -m to pastebin
looks good, no problem with ram
thanks. any other suggestions or pointers to docs for speed boosts? (other than: "buy a faster machine"). ;)
disable compiz (the desktop effects) check the speed of the hdd (hdparm)
look if "w" in top is high (which is (w)aiting for the io-devices)
re, disabling compiz: System > Preferences > Visual Effects are set to "None". Is there more to disabling compiz than that?
maybe you are on jaunty with an intel card?
Yes, I'm on Jaunty with an Intel card! What kind of difference does that make?
